question: Which article of the constitution authorities the Parliament to prescribe the duties and powers of the CAG in relation to the accounts of the Union and of the states and of any other authority or body?
explanation: The Article 149 of the Constitution of India authorises the Indian Parliament to prescribe the duties and powers of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) in relation to the accounts of the Union and of the states and of any other authority or body.
